structure.unit: A KENTUCKY UNIFORM VOIDABLE TRANSACTIONS ACT

law.catch_line: Transfer or obligation voidable as to present creditor.
law.text: (1)A transfer made or obligation incurred by a debtor is voidable as to a creditorwhose claim arose before the transfer was made or the obligation was incurredif the debtor made the transfer or incurred the obligation without receiving areasonably equivalent value in exchange for the transfer or obligation and thedebtor was insolvent at the time or the debtor became insolvent as a result ofthe transfer or obligation.(2)A transfer made by a debtor is voidable as to a creditor whose claim arosebefore the transfer was made, if the transfer was made to an insider for anantecedent debt, the debtor was insolvent at that time, and the insider hadreasonable cause to believe that the debtor was insolvent.(3)Subject to KRS 378A.020(2), a creditor making a claim for relief undersubsection (1) or (2) of this section has the burden of proving the elements ofthe claim for relief by a preponderance of the evidence.
law.history: Created 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 37, sec. 5, effective January 1, 2016.
